chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force
Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth J. Groholski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).
  • Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).
  • Attempt Attempt Robbery with Threat of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Court finds defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with the sentence he is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution to Westside Mobil in the amount of $350.00.  Joint & Several with Derrick Domka. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Seek and obtain fulltime work or school or a combination of the two.

Not possess or consume alcohol. 
Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription by a doctor and use only as prescribed. 
Not possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not associate with anyone whom he knows to be using controlled substances or using drug paraphernalia. 
Not have any contact with the Southside BP gas station or the Westside Mobil gas station.

Provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Comply with any counseling or treatment recommendations that his agent determines to be appropriate and necessary to further his rehabilitation in the community.

records.addlTxt: Granting Defendant's Rule 809.30 Motion for Postconviction Relief /s/ RJS 08/23/16

Defendant Kenneth J. Groholski in court with attorney Kara Lynn Mele.   David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:37 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Knaapen clarifies the case number and he has received the Motion for Postconviction.
Atty Knaapen states that does not object to the defendant being eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program; State will 
leave this up to the institution.
State will withdraw its request for the DNA Surcharge to be waived 
Court makes statements on the record.

BY THE COURT: 
Court finds the defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program.
JOC to be amended.
DNA surcharge is no longer an issue as State withdrew request to waive DNA Surcharge 
Atty Mele to prepare an order.
IT IS ORDERED that the time for deciding the defendant's postconviction motion is extended to August 26, 2016.  See Wis Stat Rule 809.82(2)(a).   (Copy Branch 2 Received 06/28/16)

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth J. Groholski in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Kenneth J. Groholski in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:06 p.m. Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Atty Knaapen states correction.  Makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Counts 1 & 4 - 
8 years initial confinement followed by 5 years extended supervision on each count, concurrent with each other and concurrent to sentence he is currently serving. 

Count 7 - 
4 years intial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision, concurrent to other sentences

Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
Not possess or consume alcohol. 
Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription by a doctor and use only as prescribed. 
Not possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not associate with anyone whom he knows to be using controlled substances or using drug paraphernalia. 
Seek and obtain fulltime work or school or a combination of the two. 
Provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge. 
Comply with any counseling or treatment recommendations that his agent determines to be appropriate and necessary to further his rehabilitation in the community. 
Not have any contact with the Southside BP gas station or the Westside Mobil gas station. 
Pay restitution to Westside Mobil in the amount of $350.00.  Joint & Several with Derrick Domka. 
Pay costs. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Court advises defendant of loss of firearm privileges, body armor, voting rights. 
Atty McFarland to notify of Post-Conviction. 

Atty McFarland addresses credit. 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments re: credit. 
BY THE COURT:  Parties to submit credit arguments in writing.

Sentencing hearing at 10-20-2015 02:00 pm

9:35 a.m. Defendant Kenneth J. Groholski in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Kenneth J. Groholski in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed and waived reading.
 Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No contest counts 1, 4, & 7

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty counts 1, 4, & 7.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Dismissed Read In 2, 3, 5, 6, & 8

Request for PSI report update

BY THE COURT:****PSI Report Ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
